title: Transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt for hepatic sinusoidal obstruction syndrome with primary biliary cholangitis and alcoholic liver disease: a case report.
abstract: This article reports the case of a 73-year-old man with a 50-year history of long-term alcohol abuse (with daily intake of 250 g) combined with primary biliary cholangitis (PBC, AMA-M2 positive). The patient recently developed refractory ascites and manifestations of portal hypertension (hepatic venous pressure gradient, HVPG: 17.3 mmHg).
